title.rendered: “IDF and Shin Bet Joint Operation: Arrest of 17 Wanted Individuals and Seizure of Illegal Assets Across Judea, Samaria, and Jordan Valley”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

IDF soldiers, members of the Shin Bet and Border Police mapped out last night the house of one of the terrorists who carried out the shooting attack at the Tunnel Checkpoint; the forces arrested 17 wanted individuals across Judea and Samaria, 11 of whom are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.

During the night, the forces arrested 17 wanted individuals across Judea and Samaria, 11 of whom are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.

Overnight, forces mapped out in the city of Hebron in the Judea Brigade the house of one of the terrorists who carried out the shooting attack at the Tunnel Checkpoint on November 16.

During a operation to confiscate illegal vehicles in the village of Tsurif in the Etzion Brigade, the soldiers confiscated about 40 vehicles. In addition, in the village of Na’alin in the Ephraim Brigade, four wanted individuals were arrested alongside a gun, ammunition and military equipment that were confiscated.

In addition, during an operation in the village of Tamun in the Jordan Valley and the Valleys Brigade, armed individuals fired and threw Molotov cocktails and explosives at the forces who responded with fire, a hit was identified.

The arrested wanted individuals have been transferred for further investigation by the security forces, our forces suffered no casualties.

So far, since the beginning of the war, about 2,400 wanted individuals have been arrested across the Judea and Samaria Division and the Jordan Valley and the Valleys Brigade, about 1,200 of whom are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.
